text: Alright then, let’s hear it. Your beef with Sephiroth—what’s the deal?
SOLDIER didn’t have much action back then. Even when there was work, it was mostly stuff I didn’t care about.
I’ve never gotten motion sickness before, so I wouldn’t know.
How about you tell me what this job’s about already?
If it’s another Turks gig, I’m not doing it.
I finally made 1st Class, but the ceasefire ended the war for good.
My chance to shine got ripped away.
I wanted to be a hero like you.
This mission’s to investigate an old mako reactor.
Sorry to say, it’s close to a Turks job.
Well, whatever. Having work at all’s better than nothing.
No way, I can handle it!
Speakin’ of Nibelheim, ain’t that where the world’s first mako reactor is?
The adults started freaking out, saying something was off with the reactor.
Monsters we’d never seen before started showing up near the village.
The village formed a militia, but it wasn’t enough. They asked Shinra to step in.
That’s when we got sent in.
It’s been a while since you’ve been home, right?
I wouldn’t know—I don’t have a hometown.
She died right after giving birth to me.
Jenova? You mean that thing in the Shinra Building?
What am I even talking about?
But wow, the great hero Sephiroth coming here?
Do what you want until sundown.
No childhood friends around? Like a cute girl or something?
Hey, wanna hear about the girl I’m totally into right now?
Man, this village’s got nothing going on. You were smart to leave.
They got any local specialties or what?
Oi! You forgetting the mission? Don’t leave the village.
This mud’s a mess. Let’s take turns cleaning it off.
Well, I’ll be! Hosting a hero—I’ll brag about this ‘til I die.
I’d love to snap a photo, but it’s not really the vibe.
Sephiroth went to the inn. I was too intimidated to even sneak a shot.
But you’re a nobody, right? Film’s precious around here—sorry.
Can you put in a word with Sephiroth for me?
You’re with Shinra, right? Thanks for your work.
Cloud, is that you? I didn’t recognize you.
Cloud, you’ve really grown into a fine young man.
You’re like a whole new person.
My old house. Nothing to do with the incident.
Yeah, I’d like to hear about it.
I’d like to hear about your old house.
I don’t wanna talk about it.
My dad died when I was a kid, so my mom lived there alone.
It’d been almost two years since I last saw her.
No way, Cloud, is that you?
Show me that proud figure of yours up close.
Mhm, mhm, you’re a sight to behold.
So this is a SOLDIER uniform, huh?
the girls won’t leave you alone, will they?
The city’s full of temptations, isn’t it?
If you had a proper girlfriend, mom would feel a little more at ease.
You need someone a bit older, someone who’ll take charge and pull you along.
That’s the kind of girl I think suits you.
Are you eating properly out there?
You know, mom is always your――
If you don’t wanna talk, that’s fine.
If you don’t wanna talk, that’s fine.
Did you go to my house too?
Did you go to my house too?
I thought you might be there, Tifa.
Huh, didn’t peg you for that kinda talent.
What’s this? You two were neighbors or somethin’?
Yeah, but we didn’t hang out much, did we?
It’d been two years since I’d been back. It felt nostalgic, you know?
A shaky body reflects a shaky heart. Brings back memories.
Welcome! Tonight, it’s reserved for Shinra Company folks.
It’s been two years, hasn’t it? You’ve really grown up.
Working with the hero Sephiroth? That’s a big deal!
Oh, welcome back. Sephiroth’s returned too.
I travel east and west, teaching martial arts to kids along the way.
You’re limber, but still too skinny. Eat more.
I’ve got tons of students your age.
Here in this village, I’m training a girl named Tifa.
That kid’s got talent. She’ll get strong for sure.
Cloud, you’ve got no eye for talent.
That was five years ago, you know?
I’ll be watching Shinra’s fighting style closely.
Let me know if there’s anything I can help with.
I’m working on some new techniques.
Hahaha! People of Nibelheim! Are you all striving for health every day?
I, Roche Zangan, have seen the results of my Longevity Exercises firsthand.
Keep it up, live life to the fullest, and let’s all aim for long lives together!
Now then, let me guide you directly from here!
Zangan-Style Longevity Exercises, Form One—here we go!
Point both hands’ fingertips to the sky!
Arms by your ears, palms facing forward.
Imagine an angel descending from the heavens, grabbing your wrists.
And then, you float into the air.
Stretch your body with that feeling!
Once you’re fully stretched, go up on your toes!
Feel it down to the tops of your feet—snap!
Phew—haaa—breathe slowly. Count to ten, then relax~!
Zangan-Style Longevity Exercises, Form Two—here we go!
Both hands up, arms by your ears!
Yes, palms forward! Now lift your right knee as you bend it.
Lift with your core muscles, not just your leg.
Point your toes, graceful like a bird on a lake.
Hold steady there, proud like a statue!
Don’t hold your breath—slowly out~ and in~
Soaring into the sky, flying off to distant towns and villages.
Control your body with a vivid imagination!
Zangan-Style Longevity Exercises, Form Three—here we go!
Both hands up—arms by your ears!
Next, slowly spread your arms and lower them while bending your left knee, lifting your thigh with your core strength!
Keep both hands stretched straight out like a balance beam!
Now, imagine wings of a heavenly messenger sprouting from your shoulders—you’ll feel yourself floating in the air!
Picture yourself going to visit a faraway friend.
Greet them with a "Long time no see!"
Alright, with a smile—breathe out "Haaa"—count to ten, then relax!
Take a break now—rest up properly!
Wanna give it a try, kid?
If you wanna be my disciple, start with these exercises!
Worked up a good sweat, huh?
The trick is to use your imagination while moving your body!
I didn’t notice it back then, but...
Looking back now, Sephiroth might’ve been acting strange ever since we arrived at the village.
It feels like I know it somehow.
We’re heading to the mako reactor at dawn tomorrow.
I couldn’t sleep that night. Tension, anxiety, excitement...
Have you forgotten about the mountain accident?
Isn’t that a thing of the past? She’s already a fine adult, you know.
We leave once the guide arrives.
Sephiroth, listen. I’ll be the guide after all.
It’s not too late—back out now.
With two strong SOLDIERs here, I’ll be fine!
Good morning! Looking forward to working with you!
When it comes to the best guide in this village, it’s gotta be me, right?
If you protect her, there’s no issue.
The mako reactor’s mid-way up Mt. Nibel.
Mt. Nibel was famous back then as the site of the first mako reactor ever built.
Every land with a mako reactor has a similar feel, but this place is unique.
I never tire of looking at it.
You’d get sick of it if you saw it every day.
That sounds nice! SOLDIERs get to travel all over, huh?
It’s not that glamorous. Just moving from place to place.
Obviously. You’re the one going too fast, Tifa.
But we’re in a hurry, right?
Lately, they’ve been showing up near the village too.
Looks like you can handle the monsters around here on your own.
Yeah, seems that way. Sephiroth, take a break.
I’ll take you up on that.
Hey, don’t just stand there, Mr. SOLDIER!
Looks like a long way ahead.
We’d get there quick if we ran.
More monsters than expected. Rushing leaves our defenses open.
Then I’ll go ahead and clear out the monsters.
That’s a dead end. A rockslide took out the bridge.
We’ll cut through Shinra’s land up ahead.
With you here, we don’t even need a guide.
I refused at first, but rethinking it, this was the right call.
Natural mako gas. This mountain’s still rich with mako, it seems.
It’s dangerous, so don’t breathe in too much.
Mako poisoning’s the last thing I need.
High-concentration mako gas detected. Lift currently locked.
Please relocate the air purifier to remove the surrounding mako gas.
Mako gas removal confirmed. Unlocking lift.
Mako levels normal. Lift now operational.
Follow the river downstream to the village.
We’ve got a mission. Can you get us to the mako reactor?
But we can’t let you go back alone. You’re coming with us.
I’ll be watching from your side.
Let’s get through quick. Too much mako’s dangerous.
But if we keep using mako energy, this spring’ll disappear someday, won’t it?
How long must it take for it to form like this in nature?
Hey, why can we use magic when we’ve got materia?
Materia holds the knowledge of the Ancients.
Knowledge to wield the planet’s power freely.
They say it connects us to the planet, calling forth magic.
"I won’t forgive unscientific terms like 'weird power', or calling it 'magic' either."
A guy once got mad saying that.
Hojo, from the science department. A mediocre man inheriting a great scientist’s work.
High-concentration mako gas detected. The lift is currently locked.
Please relocate the air purifier to remove the surrounding mako gas.
Mako gas removal confirmed. Unlocking the lift.
Look at that—is that the exit?
A situation after your own heart, isn’t it?
I’ll leave the rest to you.
Been listenin’ for a while now,
and Sephiroth sounds like some high-and-mighty good guy, don’t he?
Ain’t he the planet’s enemy? A damn lump of evil!
Gimme somethin’ full of hate, somethin’ that’ll make my anger explode!
I’m going inside—I want to see it!
Make sure you protect me good, okay?
I really wanted to see the mako reactor...
This guy won’t tell me anything at all!
This place is running like normal, right?
Old rural mako reactors should’ve been switched to low-output mode.
The villagers don’t know it’s still active, do they?
They oughta fix that kinda thing.
Take it up with the President.
What do you think "malfunction" means here?
Mako reactors fall under urban development, but this one’s been loaned to the science division.
I’ve got a really bad feeling about this.
What we see here stays here.
If you’re going to pray to your sword, now’s the time.
The air leaking from the pod is what’s causing the malfunction.
Cloud, go shut the valve outside.
This here is an artificial materia generator.
But Hojo put animals in it and condensed them with mako.
That’s the true nature of these new monsters.
And it wasn’t just animals Hojo put in there.
Am I the same as those monsters?
Ever since I was a kid, I’ve felt it.
I’m different from the others. I thought I was special.
And then we returned to the village.
But Sephiroth locked himself in his room.
That night, the village chief was looking forward to having dinner with the SOLDIERs.
When it got canceled, he kept grumbling to Papa.
Forget that—what about Sephiroth? What’d he do next?
He vanished from the inn that night.
Sephiroth? He stepped outside a little while ago.
Looked pretty serious. Let me know if there’s anything I can do.
Sephiroth-san just left a moment ago. Maybe for a walk?
How’d the mako reactor investigation go? Did you figure out the cause?
Sephiroth headed toward the Shinra Mansion. I called out, but he ignored me.
We haven’t even gotten a report on the reactor. What’s going on?
Sephiroth went into the Shinra Mansion. Did something happen?
Hey, once I develop these photos, could you get Sephiroth’s autograph for me?
The Shinra Mansion’s the biggest building in the village. It’s been around even longer than the mako reactor.
It used to be a research facility for the Shinra Company back when it was still small.
The rent from it was a big source of income for the village, apparently.
I looked around the mansion, but there was no sign of Sephiroth.
Yeah, I didn’t know about it until then either.
"A lifeform found in a 2000-year-old stratum, in a state of suspended animation."
"[μ]-εγλ July 7, 1977: Jenova confirmed as an Ancient."
After that, Sephiroth locked himself in the basement.
He was reading documents like he was possessed.
The sealed door in the mako reactor...
Thinking about it won’t help. I’ve gotta talk to Sephiroth.
Listen, Cloud. These records are fascinating.
"The being discovered in a 2000-year-old stratum seemed to bear an elegant smile."
"In time, I realized this being was none other than the legendary Ancient from ages past."
And so, the Jenova Project began. Its goal: to resurrect the Ancients.
And that’s how I was created.
Professor Gast, the genius scientist in charge of the Jenova Project, created me.
I’m going to meet my mother.
If I’d come to my senses sooner back then...
Maybe I could’ve protected the village.
Move it! Save as many as you can!
My son—my son’s still in there!
It’s too late—you can’t go back!
Village chief, was it really Sephiroth?
Yeah, Sephiroth did this! He’s gotta still be nearby.
Pull yourself together! You lot secure an escape route.
If I can get through here...
Sephiroth! This what a hero does?!
You bastard, what have you done?!
I chased Sephiroth to the mako reactor.
But Papa went after Sephiroth, trying to talk to him.
Mother, I’ve come to see you.
How dare you hurt Papa—hurt everyone in the village!
You promised you’d come when I was in trouble...
Mother, let’s take this planet back together.
Let’s go to the Promised Land.
The ones who stole this planet from you.
No more sadness, Mother. From now on, I’ll be with you.
How dare you hurt my mom—hurt Tifa!
I will become the ruler of this planet.
You’re not the Sephiroth I knew anymore!
Cait Sith, Nibelheim burned down five years ago.
Even if a terminal’s left, no guarantee it works.
I know about the incident five years back. But no need to fret over the terminal.
That place is still a key Shinra facility.
We won’t find the Black Materia’s spot unless we check the terminal, right?
Yeah...You’re right. Let’s go check it out.
Ain’t been back since then, huh?
I heard it all burned down, so I figured there was no point coming back.
Looks like he’s heading to Nibelheim too.
Did the black-cloaked guy from Cosmo Canyon come to call us over?
I got scared just thinking about it.
What the hell’s goin’ on here?
Don’t scare me like that! Thought you’d lost it again—
Well, "again" ain’t quite right, but still!
They’re not people I know, right?
You got business in this village?
Just droppin’ by to borrow a Shinra network terminal real quick!
This used to be my hometown...
You aware of Nibelheim’s current situation?
Since five years ago, this has been a Shinra Company restricted zone.
Now it’s a sanatorium for mako poisoning victims.
I hear all the legal rights have been sorted out.
If there’s any issues, please contact the Special Facilities Division at HQ.
We’ll just borrow that terminal real quick, then!
I get missing your hometown, but please leave as soon as you can.
Makes you wanna climb it, huh?
Hey, let’s climb up! What’ll we see?
They made it look alike, but it’s totally different. Doesn’t faze me.
See that? The inn. Stayed there five years ago.
Did you watch from up here, maybe?
Wonder if you watched Tifa from here.
Did you watch Tifa from here?
I’m not! Not even a little.
Leave me alone for a bit.
You’ve got friends to share old memories with, people who remember your childhood.
I’m so jealous of that, and I don’t know what to do with these feelings.
I might take it out on you, Cloud.
I won’t. I’d feel bad later.
I’ll come down in a bit.
Nice breeze. Must’ve been a great village.
I like it here. Really taken a shine to it.
That day, why did Papa chase Sephiroth all the way to the mako reactor?
After waking up in the hospital, I kept thinking about it.
Even if he caught up to Sephiroth, Papa couldn’t have done anything, right?
And that’s how it turned out.
But after moving to Midgar and living on my own, I got it.
Today was rough, but tomorrow’s gotta be better.
He was mad that the precious days he’d built up were destroyed.
So I turned my sadness and emptiness into anger too.
That’s why I decided to join Avalanche.
As Avalanche got more extreme, my doubts and fears grew.
That’s when I ran into you again, Cloud.
I reunited with Cloud when I was full of doubt.
Yeah, having you around gave me the guts to come back here.
A lot’s happened, but coming back was the right call.
Rebuilding it to look the same, pretending nothing happened...
Hey, back when we lived here, you used to watch me a lot, didn’t you, Cloud?
You’d look away if I caught you, ignore me if I said hi.
I was an annoying kid. Even I think so.
I was the kid who didn’t want anyone to hate her. Still kinda hate that about myself.
Oh, you’re with that noisy bunch from earlier? Foley send you?
Geez, right in the middle of my busy time!
No biggie. I’m starved for someone to chat with anyway.
Though you don’t strike me as the talkative type.
Chop-chop-chop, chop-chop! I’m a cooking genius~♪
Chop-chop-chop, chop-chop! Got it from my mom~♪
I love me some gossip! Gotta sing or I’ll spill~♪
Don’t be mean to ‘em. They’re poor souls.
Yup. But from what I’ve seen, there’s two kinds. Types? Patterns? Somethin’ like that.
Sometimes I wipe them down, y’know, and a lotta these folks have numbered tattoos.
And those same people? They’ve got marks, like from injections or somethin’.
Well, some don’t have tattoos or marks, though.
Oh...so that’s, what, three types? Four?
Couldn’t those be from addiction treatment?
What’s with the numbers? The tattoo numbers, I mean.
Beats me. But it sure gets your imagination goin’, huh?
Those black-cloaked folks? Far as I can tell, there’s two types.
Lots of ‘em have numbered tattoos, and those ones usually got injection marks too.
Well, some don’t have tattoos or marks, mind you.
Oh...so that’s three types? Or four? Oh my, oh my~♪
Sorry, talkin’ about my hometown like this...Bet it doesn’t feel good for you either.
Feels bad when someone talks trash about your hometown, right?
Don’t worry about it. This place ain’t the village I grew up in anymore.
Why’d Shinra do somethin’ like this?
Yeah, me too...That mansion’s creeped me out since I was a kid.
Gatherin’ up all these black-cloaked people...What’s Shinra plannin’?
We just call ‘em "black cloaks" all casual-like, but they’ve got proper names too, y’know.
You think all these folks just waltzed in here on their own two feet?
They wreck stuff whenever it suits ‘em, then turn around and build fakes!
What, everythin’s gotta go Shinra’s way? Not on my watch!
Why’re they gatherin’ the black cloaks?
We’ll make Shinra pay, for your hometown too!
What’s their goal with the black cloaks?
Hell if I know! Ain’t got a damn clue!
Still chained to your old Shinra days?
That’s their game—makin’ you think "Shinra, so it can’t be helped!"
I’m stayin’ here, keepin’ an eye out so Shinra don’t mess with ‘em.
Honest, I don’t get what went down five years ago, but I’m worried about you and Tifa.
If it’s too much, let’s ditch this village.
No childhood friends or nothin’? Like a cute girl, maybe?
Wanna hear about the girl I’m totally into right now?
The SOLDIER Aerith loved. My buddy from Gongaga.
Five years ago, did we come here together?
So the reactor’s up ahead, huh~? Hey, Cloud, you been there before?
A reactor means tons of mako, right?
Hey, was there any rare materia?
Yeah, there was some natural materia.
Natural stuff~! For real? Ugh~ I’m droolin’ already!
Ugh, this is why amateurs suck!
Guess the materia expert—me—has gotta check it out myself~!
Tryin’ to hog it all by trickin’ me?
C’mon, let’s go hunt some materia already~!
Cait Sith’s at the town hall?
Just who is that cat fella?
I lent him the terminal, and next thing I know, he’s usin’ connections or whatever to dig into the main database!
No way he’s just some grunt from a subsidiary.
Even if you ask about this village, I ain’t got answers for ya.
I’m just hired help here myself.
Hold on just a wee sec!
Why not take a gander at the village in the meantime?
No dice from this terminal. Access is locked down tight.
Not time to throw in the towel yet!
Hey, Manager, any chance we could get into that mansion?
Nya-ha~! No way, that’s a tall order!
I’m just a lowly Shinra resort peon, y’know!
Even my card won’t get you in there. Take it up with the higher-ups.
The boss?! Section chief? Department head?
Section Chief Murasaki’s at the Nibel Reactor, on an inspection from HQ.
Supposed to be back the day after tomorrow, but no word since yesterday.
We’re in a hurry. Let’s go ourselves.
Keep quiet about me lendin’ the terminal, alright?
Ugh, I just wanna get back to the Junon branch already.
Heard you’re headin’ to the reactor, right?
The reactor? What about that terminal business?
We need a keycard now. Gonna head to the reactor and meet this Murasaki guy.
Yep, yep, yep~! I’m comin’ too!
If you need the best guide in this village, that’s me.
Just climbing the mountain to borrow a keycard. No problem.
We might not be back for a while. Anything you’re leavin’ unfinished?
Cloud, get ready already! We gotta hurry or the materia’ll run off~!
Looks like the new bridge’ll be a shortcut.
The survey team we sent to Nibelheim got attacked by someone—or something.
Looks like it’s finally startin’, eh, kid!
The new bridge is that way.
He fell from the bridge and got swept away from here. And probably...
Tifa, you knew, didn’t you? That’s why...
I thought it might be better not to bring it up.
Zack was my friend. Forgetting him like that...
Am I just an empty shell, wanderin’ around too?
Gotta tell Aerith about Zack too.
But can you leave that to me?
Let’s keep this between us, alright?
Let’s get out fast. Too much mako’s dangerous.
Wait, all this turns into materia?
It’s way more intense than five years ago.
How long does it even take for it to form like this naturally?
Hey, let’s move on? It’s pretty thick around here too.
Almost there. Just climb up this way.
Looks like we’ll need another route.
Never guided anyone this way before. You okay, Yuffie?
Piece of cake~! Wutai’s got way crazier climbs.
There’s this huge Da-chao carved into a sheer cliff, and we had to scale it for ninja trainin’.
It was rough, but the reward made it worth it!
You get ‘em when you reach the top. Wanna share some when we finish this climb?
Hey, the guy we’re lookin’ for—his name’s Murasaki, right?
Just thinkin’ it sounds kinda Wutai-ish.
Before the war, immigrants weren’t rare. Wouldn’t be weird for second or third-gen to be in Shinra.
Oh yeah, so there’s Wutai folks in Shinra too!
Can’t we do somethin’? Let’s check it out.
Come to think of it, Wutai’s got ex-Shinra folks too, so I guess it’s even.
About the Triple Crows and Governor Sarruf who set up our provisional government.
Oh, and Colonel Glenn from the Triple Crows—he’s an ex-SOLDIER who ditched Shinra too.
Don’t lump me in with him.
Come to Wutai, and I’ll introduce ya! Why not join the provisional government?
Hey, ain’t that a great idea?
Once all this mess is cleaned up, everybody should just come to Wutai!
We’d fight Shinra as the Yuffie Squad under the provisional government!
The unbeatable Yuffie Squad, crushin’ Shinra’s army left and right, led by the gorgeous Captain Yuffie!
Alright, let’s wrap up this mess quick~!
Don’t decide that on your own.
What’s gonna happen to my mission? Change of plans...?
It’s a ceasefire right now, isn’t it?
Supposed to be. But either way...
Makes no difference to the dead.
I’ve got no clue what’s goin’ on! I haven’t done anything useful yet!
You’ve helped us plenty. Calm down.
Let’s check deeper in. Might be survivors.
Yuffie, lass, where ye at right now?
The back room of the mako spring.
Thought I’d lend a paw, so I tried tappin’ into the reactor’s terminal.
He’s dead. Looks like there was a fight with Wutai.
Let’s borrow the Shinra Mansion terminal before things get messier.
Then plug it into that terminal.
I’ll handle it remotely and get the mansion gate open.
I’ll head to the mansion first and scout for the terminal.
Once we’re at the mansion, let’s hunt for that terminal first.
I’ll sniff it out quick-like before Cloud and the crew get back~
You wait for Cloud’s group. Once ye link up, bring ‘em to us.
Can’t track us with that nose of yours, right?
Ain’t nobody else can do it, so I’m countin’ on ya.
Very well, I suppose I’ve no choice.
Cloud and the others haven’t returned yet.
I’ll catch up once I’ve joined them.
Fancy interior, huh? Cost a fortune, though it’s fallin’ apart everywhere.
Must be nigh on 50 years old, I reckon.
What kind of mansion is this?
I don’t know the details myself.
But ye saw all those black-cloaked folks in the village, aye?
Heard this place was used by Professor Hojo for experiments.
I’ll give it a wee test run myself.
Welcome to my mansion, dear intruders.
I don’t know who you lot are, but sadly, this is an abandoned facility.
Rummage all you like—I doubt you’ll find anything of value.
This is just a management AI.
Still, this place holds some fond memories. I’d rather you didn’t tromp around like you own it.
I’ll have you insolent fools leave.
AI or whatever, Hojo’s still Hojo!
That duct—I might just fit through it.
Can’t you open it from there?
Insufficient power. Please activate the generator.
Generator malfunction detected. Gate currently locked.
Please insert mako enhancer into the generator flashing red.
Mako concentration increasing. Please continue inserting mako enhancer.
Mako concentration has reached required levels.
Insufficient power. Please activate the generator.
Aye, aye...If I use the ducts, I might manage.
Leave it to me with a bang—you two just wait here.
Switching to maintenance mode. Converting duct controls to manual.
Activating weight-sensitive lift. Workers, please load cargo onto the lift.
If I toss a box from here to there, that might do it, aye?
Weight below required level. Please continue loading cargo onto the lift.
Weight insufficient. Please continue loading cargo.
Weight has reached required level. Workers, please unload cargo from the lift.
Just takin’ a breather~ Come on, let’s head up quick!
Lift paused for inspection. Please wait momentarily.
You’ll need a release key for what’s ahead.
I’m here to help you lot get out.
Rather than let you wreak more havoc here, I’ve deemed it more rational to escort you out quietly.
The release key is four sets of two-digit numbers, if I recall.
I believe it’s written somewhere in this room.
I’m tired of waiting. Come on in.
Oh, right—this is a restricted area.
It’s where we store failed experiments that got out of hand.
Well then, I’ll leave the cleanup of those failures to you.
How’s that!? Don’t mess with this cat~
Next time I see that Hojo bastard, I’ll smash those glasses into his face!
Shall we head up? Gotta find that terminal quick.
Thanks to you, the mansion’s a tad tidier now.
With those stored failures cleaned up, I suppose my job here is done.
It’s been entertaining. Until we meet again, somewhere.
